info.name: RingCentral REST API
info.description:
This is a collection of API requests associated with the Basic usage plan in RingCentral Connect Platform for Sandbox Testing.

Please use a Postman environment with the following variables: RC_SERVER_HOSTNAME, RC_APP_KEY, RC_APP_SECRET, RC_USERNAME, RC_EXTENSION, RC_PASSWORD

To use these resources, you must ALWAYS start by executing one of the OAuth "Auth" Requests first, then you can use any other requests (for the 60 minutes that the access_token you obtained is valid).

description.content: YOU MUST UPDATE VALUES IN THE "Pre-request Script" section of ALL items in this folder to match your RingCentral Sandbox Account.

request.description: Fetch access_token from DevTest environment as Admin

Returns the company business hours schedule. Business hours (and After hours - all the remaining time) schedules are commonly used for setting call handling rules - `business-hours-rule` and `after-hours-rule` correspondingly.
Updates the company business hours schedule.

Returns the user business hours schedule. Business hours (and After hours - all the remaining time) schedules are commonly used for setting call handling rules - `business-hours-rule` and `after-hours-rule` correspondingly. **Please note:** If the user business hours are set to 'Custom hours' then a particular schedule is returned; however if set to '24 hours/7 days a week' the schedule will be empty.
Updates the user business hours schedule.
Returns the current caller blocking settings of a user.
Updates the current caller blocking settings of a user.
Returns the lists of blocked and allowed phone numbers.
Updates either blocked or allowed phone number list with a new phone number.
Deletes blocked or allowed phone number(s) by their ID(s). Batch request is supported.
Returns blocked or allowed phone number(s) by their ID(s). Batch request is supported.
Updates blocked or allowed phone number(s) by their ID(s). Batch request is supported.
Creates a new outbound call out session. Currently this method is supported for Softphone/Hardphone only, since device IDs for WebRTC/Mobile apps cannot be obtained.
Initiates a conference call session.
Drops a call session.

query.description: The date and time of a call session latest change
The time frame of awaiting for a status change before sending the resulting one in response

request.description: Returns the status of a call session by ID.

Adds a new party to the call session by bringing-in an established SIP call connection. The maximum number of parties to bring-in is 10; only 1 call party can be added per request. Currently the method is supported for sessions of 'Conference' origin only.
Removes a party from a call session by ID. A party can be deleted only if supervised or parked. It is possible to delete only one conference participant per request.
Returns a call party status by ID.

Modifies a call party by ID. There is a known limitation for Mute scenario - mute via REST API doesn't work with mute placed via RingCentral apps or HardPhone. It means that if you muted participant via Call Control API and Ringcentral Desktop app you need to unmute both endpoints to bring the media back.
Answers a call on a certain device by passing the corresponding device ID in request body. Supported for call forwarding, call transfer, call flip and call queues.

Allows the user to connect multiple call session participants over a conference call bridge. The current active call session ID and party ID of the user within this session should be specified in path; the bridged call session ID and party ID of the user within that session should be specified in request body. Thus the user connects participants of two sessions into one conference call using his/her own party IDs from both sessions.
Performs call flip procedure by holding opposite party and calling to the specified target
Forwards a non-answered incoming call to the specified call party. Applicable for a call session in "Setup" or "Proceeding" state.

Puts the party to stand-alone mode and starts to play Hold Music according to configuration & state to peers. There is a known limitation for Hold API - hold via REST API doesn't work with hold placed via RingCentral apps or HardPhone. It means that if you muted participant via Call Control API and RingCentral Desktop app, then you need to unhold both endpoints to remove Hold Music and bring media back.
Ignores a call to a call queue agent in `Setup` or `Proceeding` state.

Parks a call to a virtual location from where it can further be retrieved by any user from any phone of the system. The call session and call party identifiers should be specified in path. Currently the users can park only their own incoming calls. Up to 50 calls can be parked simultaneously. Park location starts with asterisk (*) and ranges 801-899.
Picks up a call parked to the specified park location.
Starts a new call recording for the party

query.description: Identifies a brand of a logged in user or a brand of a sign-up session

request.description: Pause/resume recording
Rejects an inbound call in a "Setup" or "Proceeding" state
Replies with text/pattern without picking up a call.

Allows to monitor a call party in 'Listen' mode. Input parameters are extension number of a monitored user and internal identifier of a supervisor's device. Call session and party identifiers should be specified in path. Please note that for this method dual channel audio flow is supported, which means that you need to make one more request for monitoring the second participant of a call. And as a result of each monitoring request the client recieves SIP invite with the following header `p-rc-api-monitoring-ids` containing IDs of the monitored party and session. The flow is supported for calls with no more than 2 participants. Currently this method is supported for Softphone/Hardphone only, since device IDs for WebRTC/Mobile apps cannot be obtained.
Transfers an answered call to the specified call party. Applicable for a call session in "Answered" or "Hold" state.

Brings a party back into a call and stops to play Hold Music. There is a known limitation for Hold API - hold via REST API doesn't work with hold placed via RingCentral apps or HardPhone. It means that if you muted participant via Call Control API and RingCentral Desktop app, then you need to unhold both endpoints to remove Hold Music and bring media back.

Allows to monitor a call session in 'Listen' mode. Input parameters should contain internal identifiers of a monitored user and a supervisor's device. Call session should be specified in path. Please note that this method supports single channel audio flow, which means that audio of both call participants is mixed and delivered to the supervisor in single audio channel. Currently this method is supported for Softphone/Hardphone only, since device IDs for WebRTC/Mobile apps cannot be obtained.

query.description: Indicates the page number to retrieve. Only positive number values are accepted.
Indicates the page size (number of items).

request.description: Returns the list of extension phone numbers used for call forwarding and call flip. The returned list contains all the extension phone numbers used for call forwarding and call flip.
Adds a new forwarding number to the forwarding number list.
Deletes a forwarding number from the forwarding number list by its ID.
Returns a specific forwarding number.
Updates the existing forwarding number from the forwarding number list.

Indicates the page size (number of items per page)

Creates call handling rule on account level.
Deletes a company custom call handling rule by a particular ID.

Updates a company call handling rule.

If true, then only active call handling rules are returned

Creates a custom call handling rule for a particular caller ID.
Deletes a custom call handling rule by a particular ID.

query.description: Indicates whether inactive numbers should be returned or not

request.description: Returns an call handling rule by ID.
Updates a custom call handling rule for a particular caller ID.

query.description: The direction for the result records. If not specified, both inbound and outbound records are returned. Multiple values are accepted
View of call records. The same view parameter specified for FSync will be applied for ISync, the view cannot be changed for ISync
Call type of a record. If not specified, all call types are returned. Multiple values are accepted
Call transport type. 'PSTN' specifies that a call leg is initiated from the PSTN network provider; 'VoIP' - from an RC phone. By default this filter is disabled
Indicates the page number to retrieve. Only positive number values are accepted
Indicates the page size (number of items)

request.description: Returns records of all calls that are in progress, ordered by start time in descending order.

query.description: Extension number of a user. If specified, returns call log for a particular extension only
Phone number of a caller/call recipient. If specified, returns all calls (both incoming and outcoming) with the phone number specified. Cannot be specified together with the extensionNumber filter
The direction for the result records. If not specified, both inbound and outbound records are returned. Multiple values are accepted
Call type of a record. If not specified, all call types are returned. Multiple values are accepted
View of call records. The same view parameter specified for FSync will be applied for ISync, the view cannot be changed for ISync

**Deprecated**. Supported for compatibility reasons only. `true` if only recorded calls are returned. The default value is `false`. If both `withRecording` and `recordingType` are specified, `withRecording` is ignored

The start datetime for resulting records in (ISO 8601)[https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/ISO_8601]  format including timezone, for example 2016-03-10T18:07:52.534Z. The default value is dateTo minus 24 hours
The end datetime for resulting records in (ISO 8601)[https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/ISO_8601]  format including timezone, for example 2016-03-10T18:07:52.534Z. The default value is current time

Indicates the page size (number of items)
Internal identifier of a call session

Value of syncToken property of last sync request response

The start datetime for resulting records in (ISO 8601)[https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/ISO_8601]  format including timezone, for example 2016-03-10T18:07:52.534Z. The default value is the current moment

For 'FSync' the parameter is mandatory, it limits the number of records to be returned in response. For 'ISync' it specifies with how many records to extend sync frame to the past, the maximum number of records is 250
Type of calls to be returned.
View of call records. The same view parameter specified for FSync will be applied for ISync, the view cannot be changed for ISync
Supported for ISync. If 'True' then deleted call records are returned

request.description: Deletes filtered call log records.

item.name: Get Call Monitoring Group Member List

query.description: Indicates the page number to retrieve. Only positive number values are allowed
Indicates the page size (number of items)

request.description: Returns call monitoring group members.

query.description: Indicates the page number to retrieve. Only positive number values are accepted
Indicates the page size (number of items)
Internal identifier of an extension that is a member of every group within the result

request.description: Returns call queue group list.
Returns basic information on a call queue group extension.
Updates information on a call queue group extension.
Updates a call queue group.

query.description: Indicates the page number to retrieve. Only positive number values are allowed
Indicates the page size (number of items)

request.description: Returns call queue group members.

Adds and/or removes multiple call queue members. Please note, that this method is deprecated and legacy 'Department' entity corresponds to 'Call Queue' in modern RingCentral product terminology. In order to assign multiple call queue members please use the following method `POST/restapi/v1.0/account/{accountId}/call-queues/{groupId}/bulk-assign`.

query.description: Indicates the page number to retrieve. Only positive number values are accepted
Indicates the page size (number of items)

request.description: Viewing user account info (including name, business name, address and phone number/account number). Please note, that this method is deprecated and legacy 'Department' entity corresponds to 'Call Queue' in modern RingCentral product terminology. In order to retrieve call queue members please use the following method `GET/restapi/v1.0/account/{accountId}/call-queues/{groupId}/members`.

Updates the list of call queues where the user is an agent. This is a full update request, which means that if any queue where the user is an agent is not mentioned in request, then the user is automatically removed from this queue.
Returns call recordings by ID(s).
Returns media content of a call recording.
Returns call recording settings.
Updates current call recording settings.
Creates or updates the list of extensions to be recorded.

item.name: Delete Call Recording Custom Greeting List

request.description: Deletes call recording custom greetings.

item.name: Get Call Recording Custom Greeting List

request.description: Returns call recording custom greetings.
Deletes call recording custom greeting(s).
Returns the list of extensions to be recorded.
Creates SIP registration of a device/application (WebPhone, Mobile, softphone).

query.description: Specifies whether to apply an answering rule or not. If set to true then `answeringRule` parameter is mandatory. If set to false, then the answering rule is not applied even if specified

request.description: Creates custom greeting for an extension user.
Returns a custom user greeting by ID.
Creates a custom company greeting.

query.description: Indicates the page number to retrieve. Only positive number values are accepted.
Indicates the page size (number of items).
Type of a greeting, specifying the case when the greeting is played
Usage type of a greeting, specifying if the greeting is applied for user extension or department (call queue) extension

request.description: Returns the list of predefined standard greetings. Custom greetings recorded by user are not returned in response to this request. See Get Extension Custom Greetings.
Returns a standard greeting by ID.
Creates a company IVR menu.
Returns a company IVR menu by ID.
Updates a company IVR menu by ID.
Returns the list of IVR prompts.
Creates an IVR prompt.
Deletes an IVR prompt by ID.
Returns an IVR prompt by ID.
Updates an IVR prompt by ID
Returns media content of an IVR prompt by ID.
Makes a 2-leg RingOut call.
Cancels a 2-leg RingOut call.
Returns the status of a 2-leg RingOut call.
Makes a 2-leg RingOut call.
Cancels a 2-leg RingOut call.
Returns status of a 2-leg RingOut call.
Creates and sends/resends a fax message. Resend can be implemented if sending has failed. Fax attachment size (both single and total) is limited to 50Mb.

query.description: Indicates the page number to retrieve. Only positive number values are accepted
Indicates the page size (number of items)

request.description: Returns fax cover pages available for the current extension.
Creates a task to collect all account messages within the specified time interval. Maximum number of simaltaneous tasks per account is 2.
Returns the current status of a task on report creation.
Returns the created report with message data not including attachments.

item.name: Get Message Store Report Archive Content

request.description: Returns one of the report archives with message contents in application/zip format.

query.description: Messages received earlier then the date specified will be deleted. The default value is current datetime
Type of messages to be deleted

request.description: Deletes conversation(s) by conversation ID(s). Batch request is supported, max number of IDs passed as query/path parameters is 50. Alternative syntax is supported - user converations can be deleted by passing multiple IDs in request body as an array of string, max number of conversation IDs passed in request body is 100. In this case asterisk is used in the path instead of IDs

query.description: Specifies the availability status for the resulting messages. Multiple values are accepted
Specifies the conversation identifier for the resulting messages
The start datetime for resulting messages in ISO 8601 format including timezone, for example 2016-03-10T18:07:52.534Z. The default value is dateTo minus 24 hours
The end datetime for resulting messages in ISO 8601 format including timezone, for example 2016-03-10T18:07:52.534Z. The default value is current time
The direction for the resulting messages. If not specified, both inbound and outbound messages are returned. Multiple values are accepted
If 'True', then the latest messages per every conversation ID are returned
The type of the resulting messages. If not specified, all messages without message type filtering are returned. Multiple values are accepted
The read status for the resulting messages. Multiple values are accepted
Indicates the page number to retrieve. Only positive number values are accepted
Indicates the page size (number of items)
The phone number. If specified, messages are returned for this particular phone number only

request.description: Returns the list of messages from an extension mailbox.

query.description: If the value is 'True', then the message is purged immediately with all the attachments
Internal identifier of a message thread

request.description: Deletes message(s) by the given message ID(s). The first call of this method transfers the message to the 'Delete' status. The second call transfers the deleted message to the 'Purged' status. If it is required to make the message 'Purged' immediately (from the first call), then set the query parameter purge to 'True'.
Returns individual message record(s) by the given message ID(s). The length of inbound messages is unlimited. Batch request is supported.

Updates message(s) by ID(s). Currently only message read status can be updated. Batch request is supported, max number of IDs passed as query/path parameters is 50. Alternative syntax is supported - user messages can be updated by passing multiple IDs in request body as an array of string, max number of IDs passed in request body is 1000. In this case asterisk is used in the path instead of IDs.

query.description: Content disposition of a response

request.description: Returns a specific message attachment data as media stream.

query.description: Conversation identifier for the resulting messages. Meaningful for SMS and Pager messages only.
The start datetime for resulting messages in ISO 8601 format including timezone, for example 2016-03-10T18:07:52.534Z. The default value is dateTo minus 24 hours
The end datetime for resulting messages in ISO 8601 format including timezone, for example 2016-03-10T18:07:52.534Z. The default value is current time
Direction for the resulting messages. If not specified, both inbound and outbound messages are returned. Multiple values are accepted
If 'True', then the latest messages per every conversation ID are returned
Type for the resulting messages. If not specified, all types of messages are returned. Multiple values are accepted
Limits the number of records to be returned (works in combination with dateFrom and dateTo if specified)
Value of syncToken property of last sync request response
Type of message synchronization

request.description: Synchronizes messages.
Returns message store settings.
Updates message store settings.
Creates and sends an internal text message.
Creates and sends media messages. Sending MMS messages simultaneously to different recipients is limited up to 50 requests per minute; relevant for all client applications.

Creates and sends a new text message. You can send SMS messages simultaneously to different recipients up to 40 requests per minute; this limitation is relevant for all client applications. Sending and receiving SMS is available for Toll-Free Numbers within the USA. You can send up to 10 attachments in one MMS message; the size of all attachments linked is limited to 1500000 bytes.
Allows to send high volume of A2P (Application-to-Person) SMS messages (in message batches). Only phone number with the `A2PSmsSender` feature can be used as a sender.
Returns information on a message batch.

query.description: Internal identifier of a message batch used for filtering records
Direction of a message to filter the message list result. By default there is no filter applied - both Inbound and Outbound messages are returned
Indicates if the response has to be detailed, includes text in the response if detailed
Date to filter message list result. Messages with `creationTime` later than or equal to `dateFrom` value are returned. The default value is 1 day before the current datetime
Date to filter message list result. Messages with `creationTime` earlier than `dateTo` value are returned. The default is the current datetime
List of phone numbers (specified in 'to' or 'from' fields of a message) to filter the results. Maximum number of phone numbers allowed to be specified as filters is 15
Token of a page to be retrieved
Number of messages to be returned per request

request.description: Returns the list of outbound/inbound A2P messages sent from/to A2P phone numbers of the current account. The list can be filtered by message batch ID and/or phone number.
Returns the details of an A2P SMS message by ID.

query.description: The sender's phone number (`from` field) in [E.164](https://www.itu.int/rec/T-REC-E.164-201011-I) format for filtering messages
The reciever's phone number (`to` field) in [E.164](https://www.itu.int/rec/T-REC-E.164-201011-I) format for filtering messages
Token of the page to be retrieved
Number of records to be returned for the page

request.description: Returns the list of numbers opted out from the account. The list can be filtered by `to`/`from` phone number query parameters. Specifying `text/csv` in the Accept header downloads the data in CSV format.

query.description: Number of groups to be fetched by one request. The maximum value is 250, by default - 30.
Token of a page to be returned

request.description: Returns all calendar events created by the current user.
Creates a new calendar event.
Deletes the specified calendar event.
Returns the specified calendar event(s) by ID(s).
Updates the specified calendar event.
Returns a list of calendar events available for the current user within the specified group. Users can only see their personal tasks and public tasks.
Creates a new calendar event within the specified group.

query.description: Type of chats to be fetched. By default all type of chats will be fetched
Number of chats to be fetched by one request. The maximum value is 250, by default - 30.
Pagination token.

request.description: Returns the list of chats where the user is a member and also public teams that can be joined. All records in response are sorted by creation time of a chat in ascending order.
Returns information about a chat by ID.
Adds the specified chat to the users's list of favorites.
Sets the specified chat status to 'Read' for the current user.
Removes the specified chat from the users's list of favorites.
Sets the specified chat status to 'Unread' for the current user.

query.description: Max number of chats to be fetched by one request (Not more than 250).

request.description: Returns a list of the current user's favorite chats.

query.description: Type of groups to be fetched (by default all type of groups will be fetched)
Number of groups to be fetched by one request. The maximum value is 250, by default - 30
Pagination token.

request.description: Returns the list of groups where the user is a member.
Creates a new private chat/team.
Returns information about a group or multiple groups by their ID(s). Batch request is supported.
Updates group members. **Please note:** Only groups of 'Team' type can be updated. Currently only one operation at a time (either adding or removal) is supported.

query.description: Type of chats to be fetched. By default all chat types are returned
Max number of chats to be fetched by one request (Not more than 250).

request.description: Returns recent chats where the user is a member. All records in response are sorted by the `lastModifiedTime` in descending order (the latest changed chat is displayed first on page)

query.description: Number of conversations to be fetched by one request. The maximum value is 250, by default - 30
Pagination token.

request.description: Returns the list of conversations where the user is a member. All records in response are sorted by creation time of a chat in ascending order.

Creates a new conversation or opens the existing one. If the conversation already exists, then its ID will be returned in response. A conversation is an adhoc discussion between a particular set of users, not featuring any specific name or description. If you add a person to the existing conversation, it creates a whole new conversation.

Returns information about the specified conversation, including the list of conversation participants. A conversation is an adhoc discussion between a particular set of users, not featuring any specific name or description. If you add a person to the existing conversation, it creates a whole new conversation.

query.description: Status of the task(s) to be returned. Multiple values are supported
Page number to be retrieved; value range is > 0
Number of records to be returned per page; value range is 1 - 250

request.description: Returns the list of Glip data export tasks.

Creates a task for Glip data export and returns a link at which the exported data will be available in future once the task is implemented. The exported data can be downloaded by calling Get Data Export Task method with the specified task ID. Simultaneously no more than 2 tasks per company can be created.

Returns the links for downloading Glip data exported within the specified task. If the export task is still in progress, then only the task status will be returned. If the data is ready for downloading, then the list of URLs will be returned.
Returns the specified dataset by ID. Each dataset is a ZIP archive the size of which is limited to 1 Gb.
Returns information about one or more companies by their IDs.
Returns a user or multiple users by their ID(s). Batch request is supported.
Returns information about user preferences.
Returns webhooks which are available for the current user by group ID.
Creates a new webhook
Returns a list of all webhooks associated with the current account.
Deletes the webhook by ID.
Returns webhooks(s) with the specified id(s).
Activates webhook by ID.
Suspends webhook by ID.

query.description: The end datetime for resulting records in [ISO 8601](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/ISO_8601) format including timezone, e.g. 2019-03-10T18:23:45. The default value is Now.
The start datetime for resulting records in [ISO 8601](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/ISO_8601) format including timezone
Internal identifier of the user that created the note. Multiple values are supported
Status of notes to be fetched; if not specified all notes are fetched by default.
Pagination token
Max number of notes to be fetched by one request; the value range is 1-250.

request.description: Returns the list of notes created in the specified chat.
Creates a new note in the specified chat.
Deletes the specified note.
Returns the specified note(s). It is possible to fetch up to 50 notes per request.
Edits a note. Notes can be edited by any user if posted to a chat the user belongs to.
Locks a note providing the user with the unique write access for 5 hours.
Publishes a note making it visible to other users.
Unlocks a note letting other users edit this note. Once the note is locked (by another user) it cannot be unlocked during 5 hours since the lock datetime.

query.description: Internal identifier of a group where to create a post with the card

request.description: Creates a new message.
Deletes a card by ID.
Returns card(s) with given id(s).
Updates a card.

query.description: Max number of posts to be fetched by one request (not more than 250)
Pagination token.

request.description: Returns a list of posts from the specified chat.

Creates a post in the chat specified in path. Any mention can be added within the `text` attribute of the request body in .md format - [![:Type](id)], where `type` is one of (Person, Team, File, Note, Task, Event, Link, Card) and `id` is a unique identifier of the mentioned object of the specified type. Attachments of the following types (File, Card, Event, Note) can also be added to a post by passing type and ID of attachment(s) in request body.
Deletes the specified post from the chat.
Returns information about the specified post.
Updates a specific post within a chat.

query.description: Max number of records to be returned
Pagination token

request.description: Returns posts which are available for the current user by group ID.
Creates a new post in a group specified.
Modifies text of a post.

query.description: Identifier of a group to filter posts

request.description: Returns presence status of an extension or several extensions by their ID(s). Batch request is supported. The 'presenceStatus' is returned as Offline (the parameters 'telephonyStatus', 'message', 'userStatus' and 'dndStatus' are not returned at all) for the following extension types: Department/Announcement Only/Take Messages Only (Voicemail)/Fax User/Paging Only Group/Shared Lines Group/IVR Menu/Application Extension/Park Location.If the user requests his/her own presence status, the response contains actual presence status even if the status publication is turned off. Batch request is supported. For batch requests the number of extensions in one request is limited to 30. If more extensions are included in the request, the error code 400 Bad Request is returned with the logical error code InvalidMultipartRequest and the corresponding message 'Extension Presence Info multipart request is limited to 30 extensions'.

Updates user-defined extension presence status, status message and DnD status by extension ID. Supported for regular User extensions only. The extension types listed do not support presence status: Department, Announcement Only, Take Messages Only (Voicemail), Fax User, Paging Only Group, Shared Lines Group, IVR Menu, Application Extension.

Deletes extension(s) by ID(s). When an extension is being deleted the default API behaviour is as follows: ⋅⋅* user's direct numbers are preserved by becoming additional company numbers; ⋅⋅* user's digital lines (both device & associated phone number) are deleted. You can change this behaviour using the filters: ..* create unassigned extensions for each digital line of the deleted extension by setting the query parameter `savePhoneLines` to `true` in request path; ..* remove direct numbers of the deleted extension by setting the query parameter `savePhoneNumbers` to `false` in request path

request.description: Returns contact information on corporate users of federated accounts. Please note: 1. `User`, `DigitalUser`, `VirtualUser` and `FaxUser` types are returned as `User` type. 2. `ApplicationExtension` type is not returned. 3. Only extensions in `Enabled`, `Disabled` and `NotActivated` state are returned.

Returns the list of subscriptions created by the logged-in user for the currently authorized client application.
Creates a new subscription.
Cancels the existent subscription.
Returns the requested subscription by ID.

Updates the existent subscription. The client application can extend/narrow the events for which it receives notifications within the frame of one subscription. If event filters are specified, calling this method modifies them for the existing subscription. The method also allows to set the subscription expiration time. If other than `events` and `expiresIn` parameters are passed in request they will be ignored. If the request body is empty then the specified subscription will be just renewed without any event filter change and with expiration time default.
Renews an existent subscription by posting request with an empty body.
Returns current API version(s) and server info.
Returns current API version info by apiVersion.
